sentences.sContent: He’s been limping badly ever since the skiing accident.
sentences.sCn: 出了那次滑雪事故以后，他的腿跛得很厉害。

sentences.sContent: We badly wanted to help, but there was nothing we could do.
sentences.sCn: 我们很想帮忙，可又无计可施。

sentences.sContent: He was beaten so badly that his brother didn’t recognize him.
sentences.sCn: 他被打得连他哥哥都认不出他了。

sentences.sContent: The school is badly in need of (=  very much needs  ) some new computers.
Things started to go badly wrong (=  go wrong in a serious way  ) for Eric after he lost his job.
sentences.sCn: 埃里克失去工作以后，一切都很不如意。

sentences.sContent: ...especially to the elders or patients who are badly ill...
...The research argued that boys often perform badly in mixed schools because they become discouraged when their female peers do better earlier in speaking and reading skills...

synos.tran: 非常，很；严重地，厉害地；恶劣地

phrases.pCn: 穷困的，没钱的；境况不佳的

trans.tranOther: to a great or serious degree
